intro: Ornithogalum bergusianum, commonly known as the Bursaria lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to dry, coastal climates. The flowers bloom in spring and are followed by small, berry-like fruits that contain the seeds.
